title.narrative: OP1: WASH IN SCHOOLS AND ECD CENTRES

description.narrative: By 2021, Ministries and departments at national and sub national level have increased capacity to deliver and monitor water, sanitation and hygiene services and promote hygiene behaviors among children in rural primary schools and ECD centers

sector.narrative: Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Ministries and departments at national and sub national level have increased capacity to deliver and monitor water, sanitation and hygiene services and promote hygiene behaviors among children in rural primary schools and ECD centers

description.narrative: The launch of the national WASH in Schools standards and guidelines provided clear direction for achieving universal access to WASH services in Lao schools. The 3-Star approach adopted provided an approach to incrementally build the capacity and services of schools within available budgets, demonstrated in pilot schools in 2019 | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: # New schools that practice daily group hand-washing in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support.
Number of schools with access to basic WASH service in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
National standards for WASH in schools with a disability component available

actual.value: 2019:Government confirmed document approved. Workshop to disseminate to provinces completed
